lessons.title: Router Basics
lessons.content:
# Essential to know
- `BrowserRouter` wraps the app.
- `Routes` contains `Route` definitions.
- `Link` replaces `<a>` tags.

---

# React Router Basics

## Installation

```bash
npm install react-router-dom
```

## Basic Setup

```jsx
import { BrowserRouter, Routes, Route } from 'react-router-dom';

function App() {
  return (
    <BrowserRouter>
      <Routes>
        <Route path="/" element={<Home />} />
        <Route path="/about" element={<About />} />
      </Routes>
    </BrowserRouter>
  );
}
```

exercises.title: Basic Routes
exercises.instructions:
Complete the App component with routing.
Add routes for Home (/) and About (/about).
Add navigation links to both pages.
hints: Use Route with path and element props
Wrap Routes around all Route components
exercises.validationPrompt: Check if Routes contains two Route components with correct paths

exercises.title: Dynamic Routes
exercises.instructions:
Add a dynamic route for user profiles: /user/:userId
Create a UserProfile component that displays the userId from the URL.
Add links to view User 1 and User 2.
hints: useParams() returns an object with route parameters
exercises.validationPrompt: Check if route has :userId param and UserProfile uses useParams

exercises.title: Navigation with useNavigate Hook
exercises.instructions:
Complete the LoginForm to navigate to /dashboard after clicking login.
Use the useNavigate hook.
Also add a button on Dashboard to go back.
hints: Call useNavigate() to get navigate function
exercises.validationPrompt: Check if useNavigate is used for navigation to dashboard
